moves.3. f4 f5: this game has one weird opening.
moves.4... Rh7: For once black decides to think for themselves and do a move that does not involve copying.
moves.5. d4: could have been called the queen's gambit if it had been the first move rather than the fifth.
moves.6. e3: white seem to be developing their pieces.
moves.6... Kf7: what on earth is the king doing coming out.
moves.7. Ke2: but then i guess that this chess litertally for dummies!
moves.7... Ke6: the battle of the kings is on.
moves.9. Nc3+: white is cheating by bringing his knight into the game.
moves.10... Kc5: the king is once more back in the centre. Go black.
moves.11... Kb6: black doesn't take the pawn but believes it safer to retreat.
moves.12. Na4+: once again white checks black but has white never heard that knight on the rim is dim.
moves.12... Ka6: black king is on the edge.
moves.13. Kc4: Its not a check, well done white.
moves.14... b5: the only move black can do.
moves.15. Bxb5+: white is going for the kill it seems.
moves.15... Kb7: black is forced back even more.
moves.16... d6#: black wins it's checkmate, how did that happen?

opening: Clemenz (Mead's, Basman's or de Klerk's) opening (A00)
